meanings.definition: The practice of talking and thinking about oneself excessively.
meanings.sent1: Her constant egotisms made it hard for others to have a conversation with her.
meanings.sent2: His egotisms often overshadowed the achievements of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: At the party, his egotisms led to some awkward moments as he dominated every discussion.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, egotisms can be like a blinding light, obscuring the truth.
meanings.sent5: The film portrayed the character's egotisms in a way that made the audience cringe.

meanings.sent1: The actor's egotisms were evident in the way he demanded special treatment on set.
meanings.sent2: Her egotisms often made her come across as arrogant and unapproachable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his lack of talent, his egotisms made him believe he was the best singer in the world.
meanings.sent4: In the competitive world of business, egotisms can be a heavy anchor dragging one down.
meanings.sent5: The king's egotisms led to his downfall as he ignored the advice of his most trusted advisors.
